info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Robeson and northwestern Bladen Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hestertown, or over Lumberton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, St. Pauls, Smiths, Howellsville, Tolarsville, Duart, Butters, Hestertown, Robeson Community College, Tobermory, Barker Ten Mile, White Oak, Jerome, Tar Heel and Southeastern Regional Medical Center. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 13 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern North Carolina.
